title: Calories in Animal Style Fries
meta_description: Discover calories in animal style fries from In-N-Out, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, sodium, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard In-N-Out Burger order: french fries topped with melted cheese, grilled onions, and Thousand Island spread; medium portion.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, portion size, ingredients, and preparation; check official sources or apps for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One serving of animal style fries contains about 760 kcal, with high fat and sodium from toppings.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to regular fries (no animal style toppings)

faqs.q: How many calories in animal style fries?
faqs.a: About 760 kcal per standard serving at In-N-Out.

faqs.q: What makes animal style fries high in calories?
faqs.a: Toppings like cheese (200+ kcal), spread (100 kcal), and grilled onions add fat and calories to base fries.

faqs.q: How much sodium in animal style fries?
faqs.a: Around 1450 mg per serving, mostly from cheese and spread.
Noâ€”70 g carbs per serving, though low sugar; high fat but net carbs still significant after 7 g fiber.

faqs.q: Calories in animal style fries vs regular?
faqs.a: Animal style adds ~320 kcal over regular fries (440 kcal), due to cheese, onions, and spread.
